titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Llewellyn Gillispie, Indictment
CWG10336

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky
Bracken Circuit Court
Commonwealth of Kentucky Plaintiff
Against } Indict
Llewellyn Gillispie Defendt.

The Grand Jury of Bracken County in the name and by the Authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Llewellyn Gillispie of the offence of unlawfully erecting a fence in and across a certain public Road; Committed as follows towit.

The said Llewellyn Gillispie, on the 29th day of August in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and fifty nine in the County aforesaid, then and there being the owner and tenant of a certain tract of land, situate & being in a certain public Road, then & there being unlawfully and wilfully, did erect and cause and procure to be erected in and across said public road and upon his said land a certain fence, and unlawfully and willfully did recontinue said fence, so erected as aforesaid to continue and remain therein for a period of three hundred and sixty five days next before the time of finding this Indictment, against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

W. E. Arthur
Atto for Commth

A copy att
Richd. J. Hughey C B C C
At a Court held for the Bracken Circuit, at the Court house thereof, in the town of Brooksvill on the 25th day of February 1861.

Present
Hon S. M. Moore Judge

Commonwealth of Kentucky Plaintiff
Against } Upon Indict.
Llewellyn Gillispie Defendant

This day came the parties by their attornies, and thereupon came a Jury towit George W. Marshall, George H. B. Thompson, Thomas Perkins, James H. Murray, John H. Smarr, Jonathan Hedgecock, James Bradford, John Murray, John R. Linville, Samuel L. Marshall, John Perkins, and Daniel Byars, who being elected tried and sworn well and truely to try the issue joined, upon their oaths do say "We the Jury find the road obstructed ^by fence^ one hundred and four days

Therefore it is adjudged by the Court that the plaintiff recover of the Deft One hundred and four dollars, the fine imposed by law, agreeable to the finding of the Jury in their verdict aforesaid, and also her cost herein expended.

A copy Att
R. J. Hughey C. B C C

Bracken Cir Ct
Commonwealth
vs } Co. Indict & Judgt.
Llewellyn Gillispie
Remitted
$104 } L. Gillispie
Issd Mar 14 1861
